Package game

Class GameWorld

java.lang.Object
edu.monash.fit2099.engine.World
game.GameWorld
public class GameWorld
extends World
The world that all the maps are in, represents the virtual world that we are interacting with. The world stops running when player is absent.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private java.lang.Integer maxTurns

    Used to simulate probability.
    private int turns
    Number of turns since start of the game.
    private java.lang.Integer winningPoints
    The target eco points if reached before maxTurns, ends the game.

  • Field Details

    • rand

      private static final java.util.Random rand
      Used to simulate probability.

    • player

      private static Player player
      Stores the only Player in the game.

    • turns

      private int turns
      Number of turns since start of the game.

    • maxTurns

      private final java.lang.Integer maxTurns
      Maximum number of turns before the game ends. Only used in Challenge Mode.

    • winningPoints

      private final java.lang.Integer winningPoints
      The target eco points if reached before maxTurns, ends the game. Only used in Challenge Mode.

  • Constructor Details

    • GameWorld

      public GameWorld​(Display display, java.lang.Integer maxTurns, java.lang.Integer winningPoints)
      Constructor.
      Parameters:
      display - the Display that will display this World.

  • Method Details

    • addPlayer

      public void addPlayer​(Player player, Location location)
      Store the Player to be accessed later. The map is drawn just before the Player's turn
      Parameters:
      player - The player to add
      location - The Location where the player is to be added

    • getPlayer

      public static Player getPlayer()
      Returns the only player in the world, so we do not have to loop through all actors and find the player.
      Returns:
      The only player in the game

    • run

      public void run()
      Run the game. On each iteration the loop does the following: - displays the player's map - processes the actions of every Actor in the game, regardless of map Every 10 turns, there is a chance of raining that will add water points to unconscious Dinosaurs and add sips to the water bodies.
      Overrides:
      run in class World
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the player doesn't exist

    • stillRunning

      protected boolean stillRunning()
      Returns true if the game is still running. The game is considered to still be running if the player is still around. If the game is running in Challenge Mode, checks whether the target points is reached, or has exceeded the maximum number of turns.
      Overrides:
      stillRunning in class World
      Returns:
      true if the player is still on the map.

    • endGameMessage

      protected java.lang.String endGameMessage()
      Return a string that can be displayed when the game ends. If the game is running in Challenge Mode, returns Player won/lost depending on eco points earned before the game ended. Otherwise returns "Game Over".
      Overrides:
      endGameMessage in class World
      Returns:
      End game message

    • isChallengeMode

      private boolean isChallengeMode()
      Checks whether the World is running on Challenge Mode.
      Returns:
      true if on Challenge mode, false otherwise.
